snippet: Comptroller Scott M. Stringer’s office is holding up payments to nonprofits that shelter homeless people, saying the city may be putting people in unsafe conditions.
abstract: New York City comptroller Scott M Stringer is rejecting millions of dollars worth of contracts with nonprofit operators of homeless shelters, citing safety concerns; mayor's aides claim most required repairs have been made, and suggest comptroller's office is following pattern of politically-motivated obstruction; shelter operators worry that delay is compromising services.
lead_paragraph: Comptroller Scott M. Stringer’s office is holding up payments to nonprofits that shelter homeless people, saying the city may be putting people in unsafe conditions.

headline.main: New York Comptroller Clashes With Mayor de Blasio Over Shelter Contracts
headline.print_headline: New York Comptroller and Mayor Clash Over Contracts for Sheltering the Homeless
